item.title: Nether fortress
item.dc:creator: @Tom Tom
item.description:
@Tom wrote:

Not so much a lack of understanding, but rather a human error. Though I’ll look into it later to see if there is a way around it. I still stand by my point about keeping the nethers core functionality, though.

If the worst comes to the worst then we can just add our own artificially made fortress within the bounds of the map, I mean, why not?

Read full topic

item.title: Nether fortress
item.dc:creator: @noobs_are_ftw noobs are ftw
item.description:
@noobs_are_ftw wrote:

Tom:

Regardless, there is another way of doing it (regenerating until we have a fortress) which gives us both. I’d only ever agree with this is if expanding it in such a fashion was the only way, which it isn’t.

you dont understand how seeds work tom do you? it will always be the same nether

Read full topic

item.title: Nether fortress
item.dc:creator: @omgilikepie omgilikepie
item.description:
@omgilikepie wrote:

Even if we lose the fast teleporting by using the nether, we gain a stronghold, which will have a blaze spawner, which will give us blaze rods, which will let us make the end portal, which will let us make an endermen farm, which will give us ender pearls, which can be used for fast travel

Read full topic

item.title: Nether fortress
item.dc:creator: @Tom Tom
item.description:
@Tom wrote:

I disagree, you’re taking away a key usage of the nether, which can create confusion for newer players who expect this to function as you would get normal minecraft, for the most part. The map will also be expanding once it is populated a little more, we’re still fixing a few things but in due time more traffic will come thus populating the map more.

I’m not for changing core fundamentals of the game, especially those that can’t be configured by default, another option is to try regenerating the nether as previously said.

Read full topic

item.title: Nether fortress
item.dc:creator: @reyx7 reyx7
item.description:
@reyx7 wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:11, topic:448588”][quote author=reyx7 link=topic=551487.msg4041632#msg4041632 date=1341694522]

Increase both by 100 maybe? :o

that works, or just reset the nether map.

No. For every 8 the real world is increased, the nether gets 1. Unless you have a 1:1 ratio plugin.
[/quote]

That is right, so to increase the nether by 100, we would have to increase the main world by 800, right? That’s quite a bit too much right now.[/quote]

Alternatively, you could install a plugin that makes the nether world on a 1:1 ratio to the real world. While that benefits nether users more, it destroys the fast travel the nether offers.

Read full topic
